blog.name: bartholo-mew
blog.title: OKAY
blog.description: A memoir of someone

title: FAVORITE BnHA CONCEPT:
body:
Bakugou is the straight man in his and Deku’s relationship. 

Like, Bakugou is BIG MAD, but Deku’s just a straight up lunatic and always has been, but people don’t realize it because he’s also got so much anxiety. And nobody ever knows unless they actually get to know Deku, because Bakugou absolutely refuses to explain himself in any capacity.

Guy: Man, Bakugou, why are you such an asshole to Deku?

Deku (far in the background, possibly crying): KACCHAN, I DON’T HAVE A QUIRK, BUT I HAVE TO GO INTO THIS CAVE FULL OF BEARS! I NEED TO OR I CAN’T COMPLETE MY NOTES!

Bakugou: Fuck you. 

The best part is that it’s like 75% canon anyway.

title: My Hero Academia Two Heroes
excerpt: For all my friends who wanted to watch the BNHA movie but don't live in any countries that premiered the movie, you're in luck! Sorry, I don't have in HD, but if you're interested, I've got it here now!
description:

blog.name: an-anthology-of-dreams
blog.title: dreams
blog.description: specifically, my dreams.

body:
01

I just woke up from a dream where I was taking care of newborn kittens in my bathroom for various mha characters, specifically Present Mic, Eraserhead, and the Iida family. Today is February 11th, 2019.

  • A bunch of the kittens were frozen in ice and I had to get them out using a hairdryer.
  • Eraserhead was there for all of 2 seconds before leaving and I think Iida Tenya dropped off a few kittens before leaving and I didn’t see either one of them for the rest of the dream.
  • A couple of the kittens managed to get stuck in my cabinets and I had a hell of a time getting them out.
  • I remember Tensei went away for a bit because his child was being born at that very moment before coming back with a very small baby doll replica of his newborn daughter encased in ice and telling us (Present Mic and I) to come along and see her. I vaguely remember a hospital room and maybe the baby but I woke up soon after.
  • I also remember having to sneak into a private school (not UA) in order to do something having to do with videos, swearing, and religion, but I can’t remember what it was exactly. It was banned from the school whatever it was.

3/10 on the weirdness scale. I’ve had weirder.

blog.name: makeste
blog.title: watashi ga kita bitch
blog.description: makeste (muh-KEST). female; mid-thirties. I do weekly liveblogs of bnha, a series I've grown to love to an unhealthy degree. plus me some ultra

summary: @cecldcecld first of all, I apologize that this reply ended up being so long that I had to turn it into its own post. there were...
body:
@cecldcecld first of all, I apologize that this reply ended up being so long that I had to turn it into its own post. there were just a lot of things I wanted to say, and the whole thing kind of ballooned out of control somewhat.

anyway, I’m not too concerned with Deku’s growth in this arc myself, but let me explain my thoughts on this.

  1. first off, 20% is still pretty much a last resort thing for Deku right now. he can hold it for a little while, but it’s excruciatingly painful and he can’t keep it up for long.
  2. second, unless the series goes on indefinitely, he has to get stronger at some point. Horikoshi has said that he doesn’t have the stamina for the series to be as long as One Piece (currently 933 chapters and counting). so let’s suppose that it ends up being 800 chapters (which is still much longer than he probably wants it to be lol). that would mean that as of chapter 155, the series was just shy of being 20% complete. so it makes sense for Deku to be able to use 20% of OFA, if you think of it that way. he needs to be able to use 100% by the time the series ends, so they can’t drag it out forever.
  3. I think Bakugou could still take Deku at 20%. he was able to beat 8% Deku fairly easily (only thrown off by that punch at the end), and he’s also shown himself capable of reading Deku’s moves, which as we see in this fight is still Deku’s biggest weakness. call me crazy but I think he’s still got this.
  4. Bakugou himself is not at the peak of his growth yet. he’s going to keep getting stronger too. for that matter, I think we’ve yet to see what he’s currently capable of. if you think about it for a sec, with the exception of the exam battle against All Might (and that was friggin’ All Might), he has yet to be seriously injured in a fight, let alone defeated. he held his own against six villains at once in the Kamino arc and made it out unscathed. he proved to be a match for Todoroki’s ice power, although he hasn’t yet been tested against Full ASOIAF Todoroki (not for lack of trying though). he beat 8% Deku easily enough, as previously stated. in fact, he consistently finds himself in situations where he needs to hold back and can’t use his full power so as to avoid collateral damage. Horikoshi has been very careful not to reveal his full hand here. I think if Bakugou ever were to find himself in a situation where he had to go all out, his power would be on a level we haven’t come close to seeing up till now.
  5. I don’t think Deku is ever going to fully surpass Bakugou. just like I don’t think Bakugou is going to surpass Deku. the series continually hints at the two of them working together to become the new Greatest Hero. it’s a whole “together they’re more than the sum of their parts” type of thing. Deku of course is The Main Character and All Might’s successor, and the one who will eventually defeat All for One, but he won’t do that alone. Bakugou is the future Symbol of Victory, and so he’s not going to lose that easily.
  6. that being said, if Deku ever does unequivocally surpass him, I don’t think that’s a “poor Bakugou” situation. if that ever does happen, then good for Deku. he deserves it. he’ll have earned it. Bakugou, as we all know, is not the type to want victory to just be handed to him. if the ones he’s competing with aren’t at their full strength, then there’s no point. and Deku is All Might’s successor, so as much as the two of them have their rivalry thing going on, there’s part of Bakugou that still feels responsible for what happened to All Might, and that part of him wants Deku to succeed. and we are of course still working on him fully grasping the idea that one person’s success doesn’t automatically equal everyone else’s failure. he and Deku can both succeed. he doesn’t have to fear Deku’s growth. they can both fulfill their hero dreams. eventually he will figure that out. and that will actually make him stronger than ever, being able to let go of that fear. once he finally learns to put that aside, the sky’s pretty much gonna be the limit for him.


anyway! once again I apologize for responding to your short comment with this whole big thing. ;; but basically the short version is that as a Bakugou fan, I see Deku’s growth as a good thing, because the two of them are supposed to push each other! if Deku gets stronger, Kacchan gets stronger, and vice-versa. so it’s good! I am on Team Let Deku Be A Badass lol. he’s my boy too and I love him.

  1. first off, 20% is still pretty much a last resort thing for Deku right now. he can hold it for a little while, but it’s excruciatingly painful and he can’t keep it up for long.

  3.   4. Bakugou himself is not at the peak of his growth yet. he’s going to keep getting stronger too. for that matter, I think we’ve yet to see what he’s currently capable of. if you think about it for a sec, with the exception of the exam battle against All Might (and that was friggin’ All Might), he has yet to be seriously injured in a fight, let alone defeated. he held his own against six villains at once in the Kamino arc and made it out unscathed. he proved to be a match for Todoroki’s ice power, although he hasn’t yet been tested against Full ASOIAF Todoroki (not for lack of trying though). he beat 8% Deku easily enough, as previously stated. in fact, he consistently finds himself in situations where he needs to hold back and can’t use his full power so as to avoid collateral damage. blog.name: character-leg-percentage
blog.title: Leg Stats Galore
blog.description: A blog that measures how much of a character is leg. [Submissions temporarily back open]

question: tenya iida
answer: Tenya Iida from My Hero Academia is about 50.8% leg!

reblog.comment: Tenya Iida from My Hero Academia is about 50.8% leg!
